meanings.definition: A white crystalline alkaloid found in cinchona bark.
meanings.sent1: The cinchonine extracted from the bark is used in medicine.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist recommended cinchonine for treating the illness.
meanings.sent3: The bitter cinchonine made the patient scrunch up their face.
meanings.sent4: The taste of cinchonine was as bitter as a lemon peel.
meanings.sent5: The purity of cinchonine crystals sparkled under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A substance used in the treatment of malaria.
meanings.sent1: Doctors prescribe cinchonine to combat malaria infections.
meanings.sent2: The hospital stocked up on cinchonine for the upcoming malaria season.
meanings.sent3: The mosquitoes avoided the cinchonine-treated patients like the plague.
meanings.sent4: Cinchonine acted as a shield against the malaria parasite.
meanings.sent5: The cinchonine medication brought relief to the feverish patient.

meanings.definition: A compound with a bitter taste.
meanings.sent1: The bitter cinchonine lingered on the tongue long after swallowing.
meanings.sent2: The tonic water contained a hint of cinchonine bitterness.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added cinchonine to the dessert, creating a bitter surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a cinchonine bitterness that stung more than expected.
meanings.sent5: The bitter cinchonine flavor was unforgettable, like a sharp memory.
